website_summaries.verdict: The original Spirograph set you remember from childhood.
pros: Carrying case helps keep the parts organized
Comes with tacky putty to help hold the design pieces in place
cons: The pens included could be better and seem to run out of ink quickly

customer_reviews.title: Needs some push pins and mounting surface.
customer_reviews.text: I've got an original from the 70's and they haven't changed much, if at all. They include that tacky clay sold for nonmarking use but I often have to work to get it all removed from the paper and gears. Now it may hold the gears to the paper but the paper will slide around messing up your little designs. I highly recommend getting push pins and a cork board (or cardboard) to keep things steady.
customer_reviews.author: Impact9

customer_reviews.title: Throwback to the good times
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I don't know what I was thinking would happen. It is just as fun as I remember it being, no more and no less. After a few skips out of the frame I get frustrated and the whole "relaxation" thing stops. It is great for anyone who is interested, I just suggest using small point pens instead of their large bullet nib felt pens.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money.  Such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest rip off I've seen lately. My 6 year old niece wanted this for her birthday. I had one as a child and loved it so I ordered it. We didn't get around to opening it until Friday. I was so disappointed and mad. It doesn't have the holder to put the paper in with the teeth to guide the little circles. It's also made of very cheap flimsy plastic. I couldn't get it to do anything. My niece called it junk and she was right. Just throw your money away at least you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: P. Pitman

customer_reviews.title: An iconic toy that is still great fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my granddaughter, who is 8. We came across a Spirograph at a kid's science museum, and she fell in love with it. This is a great version of the Spirograph and at a great price. I also loved Spirograph, as I had one 50 years ago. Amazing that the joy of this continues. There is so much entertainment and hidden education in this toy, and best of all, it doesn't have an LCD screen or need to be plugged in! I am so glad to see this toy is still around. My granddaughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Not as great quality as the old version, but still fun for kids that like to draw
customer_reviews.text: I use to play with one of these sets as a kid, so I got this for a young relative who likes drawing as I thought she would enjoy this. This set has a good variety of drawing shapes to do various doodles and things. The little carry case box, although not fancy, works for keeping everything together. The pens are mediocre and could be better quality, but considering the price, the set is ok overall, although the plastic spirographs are not quite as good as the original that I remember. She likes it nonetheless and is enjoying making various shapes and drawings. 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: JWINK

customer_reviews.title: not made as well as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: The box says it is for ages 8 & up. I'm 64 and I had a terrible time with this product. First, the box says it comes with 45 pieces, but they count the 20 pieces of paper the set. Then, they think that the puddy that is suppose to hold the ring in place will actually work. It doesn't work that well. the stationary ring keeps lifting and the spinning ring goes underneath and the 64 year old ruins the picture for the 8 yo and words fly. This is a terrible design
customer_reviews.author: William Holsinger

customer_reviews.title: The perfect birthday choice!
customer_reviews.text: I just gave the review for the large pad that I purchased to go with this spirograph as if it was this one...anyway, this does come with a small pad of paper, but I chose to purchase a larger one as I knew my 7 year old great grand daughter would go through any paper around the house she could find. I bought it for her birthday and as she loves it so much, I'm thankful that I chose this instead of another doll or game.
customer_reviews.author: JoDee

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for the right kid
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great gift. The 8 year old girl I gave it to would disagree. She hated it. I think it just totally would depend on your recipient. I think I just misjudged. The packaging is great, it makes a great presentation. I also ordered a big set of gel pens to give along with it. This set has a lot of great pieces to make a lot of designs. The box makes great storage. My advice would be "know your audience." I think many kids would love to get this.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This item was a real disappointment. I had one of these when I was a kid and I loved it. The way this works now you have to use small pieces of silly putty to keep the outer ring in place. Heaven for bid that silly putty slip and your artwork is ruined. I would pay more for this to be a better designed product. However since I can’t go back in time and get my old one from the 1980s my daughter is stuck with this. I would not recommend this for someone who fondly remembers a spirograph of their own.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Windey

customer_reviews.title: good for kids but has flaws
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do with my 8year old grand daughter. She loved it. We enjoy making the different patterns, with the different colors. I dropped it one star because of two reasons. the red pen dried out real quick when we lost the top to close it. It is more like a tiny felt pen than regular ink. Ink would have been better. YES, regular ink pens CAN be used, but ti is annoying. They give you sticky tack to hold the outer ring down, and it just does not work. We just did it the old fashioned way, cardboard and stick pins. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Thorman

customer_reviews.title: Fun but need grow-up’s help
customer_reviews.text: This brings back childhood memories, although back then I didn’t have a whole fancy set but only one tool to make “arts”. However, this set is very difficult for my kids to use without adult help. The base won’t stay put and it keeps getting lifted off the paper, making it hard to keep a smooth run.
customer_reviews.author: TranPhamily

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgic play with my girls!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter whom is 7. Her older sister is really into drawing and coloring. My 7 year old cant quite draw as good and it frustrates her. I got her this spirograph because I had one when I was little and loved it . Now my 7 year old can create beautiful stuff like her sister. My 11 year old actually loves to play with it too .
customer_reviews.author: Geek Mom

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: There is no way to hold the plastic rings in place. It comes with sticky putty to stick them to paper. But it doesn’t stick. So this rings slide all over. Making the set worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Erin Stier

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly poor product case !!
customer_reviews.text: The packaging, storage box is utterly useless. It arrived in shambles ... cheap glue, cheap construction. So you have to figure out a different place to store all the content.
customer_reviews.author: Reza Khalili

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: Too difficult to keep rings in place. Older models had pins to keep rings in place with piece of cardboard as backing. Now it’s pice of sticky putty which is about useless. Doesn’t stick for a lengthy time because it dries up before a child can get design finished. Tried using pushpins holes in big rings too small for pushpins. Perhaps mapping pins will work.??
customer_reviews.author: Dana L. Wildwood MO

customer_reviews.title: Missing pens
customer_reviews.text: This was missing the pens they live out of town and it was a present
customer_reviews.author: David & Wendy Moyte

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Very very dissapointed in this item. My daughter was so excited to get it. The pens were out of ink , the putty does NOT hold the circle thing down. There is no way to make designs with these little circles . Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly C. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: You spin me right round, baby Right round like a record, baby
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be easy for most people to do but I keep jacking it up...I'd get close to the end of a design and I'd fudge it up. Don't like my inadequacies dissuade you in any way, this still holds up and is a cool way to add a little somethin' somethin' to hand-made card or when returning a paid parking ticket. Spin away!
customer_reviews.author: ADAM J. CANTU

customer_reviews.title: Takes you back!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 7 year old's birthday. He loves drawing and coloring and this was a huge hit. I also loved playing with this as a child and it instantly took me back. It isn't the same quality as from when I was a kid (I'm 43), and holding the wheel and page with putty is a little strange. It holds ok but not great, especially for a child who isn't going to go super slow. I ended up just holding the wheel with my hand. Still a lot of fun, easy to get out- easy to put away.
customer_reviews.author: dancingirl76

customer_reviews.title: The clay does not hold the frames in place.
customer_reviews.text: When I was a kid, Spirograph came with pins to hold the frames in place. Now you get to try to mold clay and attach the clay to the frame and press down on the paper to make the frame stay in place. IT DOES NOT WORK!! My niece was disappointed as I tried to hold the thing in place with my fingers so she could make it work. We will end up having to buy bulletin board material and pins for her to use. I guess the lawyers didn't want small pins in the hands of kids.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Spirograph kit for my daughter’s 7 year birthday. She was really excited, however, the kit is poorly designed in my opinion, as it only provides a small piece of sticky putty to hold the frame gear piece steady to the paper. The putty will quickly dry and be used up, rendering the kit useless once unavailable. The kits I used when I was a kid had a frame to put the paper under to be held in place. The next option once the putty is gone is to tape the pieces to paper, which will likely result in tears.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: Fun for kids. Brought back memories of when I was a small child. I enjoyed hours of playing with my spirograph. Kids now a days have too much going on to sit still too long. But they too enjoy the designs that they can make with this set. Box serves as a nice package for all the pieces to keep them organized.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G

customer_reviews.title: Relive the Past
customer_reviews.text: Great product and quality. This pmbrought ne back to my childhood. The wife and I played with this (I mean we were showing the kids how to use it lol). It was great then and still is now. Combine this with some fine tip colored sharpies and you're set for some indoor fun, especially now that everyone is forced to stay home.
customer_reviews.author: Fredo

customer_reviews.title: Spirograph Review
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter and she loved it. Came on time and no puchasing issues. Contents were exactly as shown... i probably should have waited a couple more yrs because my daughter.is 4yo and this takes a bit of dexterity. Overall tho, highly recommended and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Due to the extremely poor quality of the items I purchased at Christmas, for my 11 yo grandson, I wanted to return all but 2. Each one was opened and packaging torn up. The quality and reviews I read beforehand, on each purchase ahh.. does it really matter? Nevertheless.. Disappointed, you bet! Trouble, Spirograph and others I could not honestly even comment on. A sign of the times? What do you all think? Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Peg Quinn Williams

customer_reviews.title: Messy
customer_reviews.text: The parts do not stay in the box when it is closed. Every time we have to set everything up again. After the third try my five year old figured out how to do it by herself. Not very intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: SmallDogs

customer_reviews.title: my granddaughter is 5 and enjoyed playing with her spirograph
customer_reviews.text: my granddaughter is 5 and enjoyed playing with her spirograph. Easy to follow and she loved her art work. Great job by Amazon. Every piece as a masterpiece. Inks were great.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: Well manufactured product, and laid out nicely in box for storing when not in use. Be sure to match the age of child or ability to this product. Always a positive lesson when adult begins it’s use together with child!
customer_reviews.author: Susan D

customer_reviews.title: Interactive Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: My teen loves this! Gives her something both entertaining and creative to do for hours. It's a bit difficult at times to get the shapes to move in their patterns correctly, so you definitely need to have a steady hand for this and little ones may find this just too hard to do.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, and my five year old is really enjoying it, although he'll have to develop some dexterity to be more effective with it. My only disappointment is the putty used to hold the ring in place. It's not very sticky and doesn't seem like it will hold up over time. I wish it was still like the old fashioned sets that pinned the paper down.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Kinda okay
customer_reviews.text: The toy itself was as expected. But the gummy putty stuff they send to stick the plastic down was useless. It was so dry it literally just snapped off instead of being the slightest bit flexible. Forget being sticky....lol. Works fine just to hold it down with your other hand though.
customer_reviews.author: kjw

customer_reviews.title: Great for Gifting!
customer_reviews.text: My son found a single action, one piece spirograph in a quarter machine and he loved it. So I had to get him this set. It came really fast and he loved it! There are a lot of different things for him to do.
customer_reviews.author: M. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, great gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter based on my experience with Spirograph as a child. It allows free creativity to reign and encourages forethought. This is a unique gift for kids (and maybe adults)!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: An oldie
customer_reviews.text: I remember Spirograph from when I was a kid. I had a couple of them during my childhood. Then I saw them for sale here. I should have known it would be cheaply made, not nearly as good as the original, even though the original wasn't that good. Yet, I hoped. I'm disappointed. I really wish someone would come out with a professional grade Spirograph. With metal wheels, and better holding systems for the wheels.Maybe someday. This set is for older kids. Youngsters will get frustrated with it pretty easily, what with the slipping gears and stray lines you end up with.
customer_reviews.author: SuzyQ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, creative gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our granddaughter when she turned 7. She loves it and spends time creating with it and making beautiful designs. Easy to store and take along on a road trip or vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: Useless without putty
customer_reviews.text: This is not like the Spirograph I grew up using. There is no frame that keeps the wheels in place so you must use putty to hold them down. The kit came with a tiny stick of putty that was dry and hard and useless. I just had to order a $6 package of putty to use with it, because without it the kit is useless. It’s impossible to hold it steady. Very frustrating for me and the 7yo nephew I gave it to as a present.
customer_reviews.author: BodhiCattva

customer_reviews.title: So glad these are still made!!
customer_reviews.text: When I was a kid, I had a Kenner Spirograph set and loved drawing for hours with different colours of pens and papers. Now, my grandson is enjoying this one and he is enthralled with what it can do, so close to the original!! Highly recommended for kids to spark their creativity!
customer_reviews.author: ljgfab4

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for all to enjoy
customer_reviews.text: Made a great gift for all 3 great nieces to share and enjoy creating designs together. Loved watching then share and create together in harmony
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Great
customer_reviews.text: Lots of Fun! The putty was dried out but we just hold the wheel in place with our other hand. No big deal, still works great! I'm sure we could buy silly putty from the dollar store if we need it. Hours of creativity! Love this product!!
customer_reviews.author: LorettaO.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for All
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for the 8 year old I purchased this for. She and her 4 year old Sister play for hours (quietly) ~ a gift for parents too!
customer_reviews.author: dmr2000

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Not like the ones we used as kids. Not easy to use and required the use of the tacky stuff that was in the box just to even attempt to use.
customer_reviews.author: Teryn boy mom

customer_reviews.title: Spirograph
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this. I remember my kids having this when they were younger. Love the case it came in. Was delivered early.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: It’s oaky
customer_reviews.text: It takes some practice to get the lines to work. The pieces are separate and you need to have a steady hand or another tool to hold the stencil in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M. Youngman

customer_reviews.title: Hours Of Fun
customer_reviews.text: I was scrolling through for Christmas ideas for my grand daughter when I saw Spirograph. This was something I got for Christmas when I was a child. I was so excited and ordered 1. My granddaughter and I have played for hours .
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Dreyer

customer_reviews.title: Spirograph is Just Too Complex
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to get this for my grandchildren but way too hard for them. Probably good for an Engineer but maybe shouldn't be in the toys for kids section.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Bayer

customer_reviews.title: loved playing with it as a kid
customer_reviews.text: This brings me back to my childhood, loved playing with it as a kid. My daughter wasn't sure of it at first, but caught on quickly and loves them. It seems it would be helpful to have something to hold down the outer ring better while using it, but not a major issue. Lots of fun and memories!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Set for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter for Christmas cause she likes the toys from “back in the day” and it brought me back to when I had my own set it has a lot of pieces and ideas. The case did fall apart the first day that’s my biggest problem but it won’t stop me from buying more sets 😊
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Educational Toy for Children
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as a gift for my six year old grandson. The shipping time was excellent. The package arrived safely and in the time frame specified by Amazon. He was thrilled when he opened it and has spent many hours of fun. Very educational and inspiring product. Will recommend this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Nice variety of disc sizes and designs
customer_reviews.text: The designs are really cool and there are enough discs to be really creative. However, there are not enough pens and colors. I did, however, purchase a pack of additional color retractable pens, which helped. The older children really seems to like it.
customer_reviews.author: savvy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Just like when I was a kid.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set with lots of different items to work with. I remember having one of these when I was a kid and plan to give this one to my grandson. It has a nice case for keeping everything together.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma D

customer_reviews.title: Handing down childhood memories
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with the original Super Spirograph, and bought this for our 7-yr-old grandaughter. The first design she sends is going on the fridge!
customer_reviews.author: Annamaria T. Baumann

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s good drawing tools. I am excited to get it. However, it’s for my daughter. She doesn’t interested to it.
customer_reviews.author: Dora

customer_reviews.title: great art
customer_reviews.text: loved this growing up and wanted my grandson to do some art stuff. he liked it. have to buy extra pens to make it colorful though. get them on line gel pens...
customer_reviews.author: dawgsmum

customer_reviews.title: Fun and nostalgic
customer_reviews.text: All of the adults were calling dibs on who was going to play with it next. I even heard an adult asking it for a Christmas present next year. Great stress reducer for adults. 😂
customer_reviews.author: darci

customer_reviews.title: Good gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my niece. She loved it! Great toy for kids who are into art/drawing
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Radial Design and Spirograph combined
customer_reviews.text: I got this Spirograph for my middle school students to use as an extension project of our Radial Design. Most had never seen or heard of a Spirograph which was a big inspiration for me to have them use it. They had a great time using it as the "starter" for their radial designs that had to fill the page. It held up to 3 classes of 7th graders using it over a 4 day stretch and I will definitely implement it again!
customer_reviews.author: cjb

customer_reviews.title: Grandson spends hours creating cards, pictures, etc.  Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I like things for my grandchildren that keep them off the hand held devices. He loves this and spends happy hours being creative.
customer_reviews.author: Ja Presler

customer_reviews.title: Fun for both adults and kids
customer_reviews.text: The old spirograph contained push pins to secure the larger circle that are used to hold the smaller circles. I was disappointed that this version was missing those pins.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Doland

customer_reviews.title: It’s fun but definitely not as good as the original version.
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren enjoyed it but it’s not nearly as easy to use as the original version.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Nice set that is made to keep the materials organized and contained
customer_reviews.text: Nice packaging and easy to keep all of the supplies together, which is important for moms! Fun set with several papers to use the tools in the kit. Quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Dunkerley

customer_reviews.title: This is how an uncle wins Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: The kids love this! I won Christmas this year and I attribute that partly to this gift. Cool way to import mechanical engineering into art too!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: fits our needs
customer_reviews.text: This worked out perfectly in my school's indoor recess area! The kids love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mathtchrj

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and damaged
customer_reviews.text: Only uploaded one pic but have 3-4 more. This was listed as new. But looks like a dog chewed on the box. Didn’t bother to open to see how damaged the inside pieces were. Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: LOVETarget Mom

customer_reviews.title: Blast from the past.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Spirograph as a kid and was excited to see it is still available and as I remember it. I bought one for my 9 y.o. who likes it too. It comes in a fold open case with a handle for easy carrying for kids hands. Son was disappointed that it only comes with three colored pens. But it advertises only having three.
customer_reviews.author: WInative

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: Really hard for young kids. Definitely for older kids. Id say 10+. Also, you have to use sticky tack to hold the outside stencil down and I wish it came with a piece that actually holds it in place like the ones when I was a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Megan H

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for one of my nieces. She likes it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: I always wanted my own Spirograph set
customer_reviews.text: I never got one as a child so now I have a set as an adult to use in my crafting and card making.
customer_reviews.author: brm

customer_reviews.title: Great for my granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this Spirograph! It comes in a really sturdy case also
customer_reviews.author: Slick1983

customer_reviews.title: Lots for the imagination
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who loves to create things. It has quite a few pieces and allows a big imagination in giving someone lots of options to create some cool looking designs. Cost is low and keeps the kids busy.
customer_reviews.author: PritchFam

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Loved as a child and an adult and doing with the kids
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another classic toy
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn't like spirograph? It's changed a bit since my days of playing with it but the grandkids enjoy it none the less.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L.

customer_reviews.title: Encourages creativity and dexterity
customer_reviews.text: These are always a favorite with the kids. They love creating a wide range of designs.
customer_reviews.author: Grraandma

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Wife loved it got it for her as a Christmas gift .
customer_reviews.author: eric rauber

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Was a real hit with my grown up children last Christmas. It brought back a lot of memories for them and me!
customer_reviews.author: dragonfly11

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our Grandkids love it. They use the set to embellish their hand drawn pictures and paintings. It takes hand coordination to do it well, good training for the future handwriting! Fun!
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The pieces and pens don't stay in their holders, so everything falls out. Pretty annoying. But, it's a very entertaining activity for my 6 year-old!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M. Fellows

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived great condition, easy to use - comes with pens though I ordered extra fine point as well
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Superb. Kid is well pleased with this and so am I.
customer_reviews.author: DrDammit

customer_reviews.title: Super fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as s gift for my friend's son but tried it first before giving it to him (because of some negative reviews here wanted to make sure it's a real deal). I liked it! If I had more time I'd love to play it myself. It's challenging but works good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Old school fun
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money. Fun for artists and those who just love to play with colors and designs. Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Rufus

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter so mailed it to her and after a couple days playing with it she didnt like it. We found out only the plastic wheels were in it. NOTHING else!! Too late to return and such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Manriquez

customer_reviews.title: Even I’ve been known to use these as it brings back wonderful memories of my own childhood
customer_reviews.text: My youngest loves being creative so with the addition of gel pens this allows her to expand her creative side! Even I’ve been known to use these as it brings back wonderful memories of my own childhood.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S. Carnahan

customer_reviews.title: Given as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Have not heard how the person who received this as a gift liked it but they were happy to unwrap it!
customer_reviews.author: T. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Gifted this item to my child for Xmas and she loved. Super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Blanca

customer_reviews.title: Fourty-Five Pieces???
customer_reviews.text: Yes it is flimsy, but was brought for an adult that would take good care of it. Ad says it includes 45 pieces which include 20 pieces of paper, the instruction book and the case. You do NOT get 45 drawing pieces of drawing instruments and/or pens. Pen are a joke, use your own pencils.
customer_reviews.author: Nanna and Papa on the lake

customer_reviews.title: A NICE GIFT
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my kid and she enjoyed very much. Durable. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Jose Vilela O

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps for Older People Looking Back
customer_reviews.text: Got one for each of my nieces aged 8 and 11. They never really got into it, possibly because there were too many pieces and it was too complicated and they seemed to have little interest in the results it produced. It is an old school toy I guess and kids today have too many options with a greater wow factor. Both of the kids love to draw so I thought this would work but it didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun for both adults and children
customer_reviews.text: This item is more than a toy, it's something that helps awaken children's creativity and for us adults it's fun to watch the lil' ones have an outlet for their creative stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than wanted
customer_reviews.text: I assumed this would have been bigger to be able to cover a whole page in one drawing. The biggest ring is around 4" so not as big as I would have liked. But overall a decent kit.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Piatt

customer_reviews.title: Keepin' it old school
customer_reviews.text: Not quite what you remember from the 90's but same basic concept just not as well made as the old sets. Kids still seem to enjoy it and it definitely inspires creativity.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: THE PRODUCT IS AS THE SELLER OFFERS IT AND IT WORKS CORRECTLY, I AM SATISFIED WITH MY PURCHASE
customer_reviews.author: Ismael Quintanilla

customer_reviews.title: Fun but a big drawback that can add frustration
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun activity that lets you be creative. There are endless possibilities for designs. The main drawback is the putty that you use to hold the ring in place. It is dry and hard and can raise the ring too high so that the center disc doesn’t work. In the old days there was a plastic anchor you put under the paper that worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: Becky H

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed that my 5 and 7 year olds did not ...
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that my 5 and 7 year olds did not care for it. Do not buy it for young kids I guess. However, the product is sturdy and good
customer_reviews.author: Brahmin

customer_reviews.title: Old favorite
customer_reviews.text: I loved it when I was young, kids not as much.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. The putty that you use to hold down was dry, so we used tape and that messed up the paper with the drawlings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like It...
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw this product I wanted to get it right away...It reminds me when I was younger...I got the product as expected. I like it. The only problem with this is that as i'm doing the spirograph deisng the inner gear slides out every time. I'm not trying to give a bad feed back and don't get me wrong, I like it. Maybe I just have to get it right. I will still recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gatita15

customer_reviews.title: Nice BIG set . lots of different stencils .
customer_reviews.text: Nice BIG set . my 9 yr old and her friend love it. Wish theyd put more paper in it though. It's an expensive set.
customer_reviews.author: MdewakantonMommy09

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as pictured. High Quality. Exactly how I remember it being as a kid. My daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Redleg27

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Fun
customer_reviews.text: Fun kit! Gives easy instructions on how to make certain patterns and shapes. Comes with plenty of paper to practice too.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fun Fun
customer_reviews.text: Reminds me of my childhood. I’m having so much fun using it with my grandson. Love it then love it now
customer_reviews.author: Sonny C. Roche

product_meta.title: Spirograph Original Deluxe Art Set
product_meta.description:
The Classic way to create countless amazing designs. The kit features a high quality, durable carrying case with snap-in storage and a built-in drawing surface. The precision engineered Spirograph gears work with the 3 design pens included in the set as well as with most standard pens, markers and pencils. The new Spirograph Putty holds the Spirograph pieces securely on the paper so that you can create intricately beautiful designs with no holes in the paper. The set also comes with 20 sheets of design paper and a full-color design guide, which explains the fundamentals of drawing with Spirograph as well as step-by-step instructions for creating your own designs.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Since it was first introduced in 1965, Spirograph has made it possible for aspiring artists of all ages to create beautifully intricate designs, originally developed as a drafting tool, by a mechanical engineer named Denys Fisher, the distinctive wheels and rings of the Spirograph cleverly combine, the principles of art and mathematics in a way that has inspired and delighted generations. Now you too can create your own cool designs and awesome pictures with the help of this fun and classic Spirograph drawing accessory. Put your paper in place and then choose again and again from 19 different gears to mix and match patterns and create a totally awesome image. Use the design guide to try out tried and true designs or get creative and create cool and colorful graphics of your own. Drawing accessory includes tray with built-in storage and includes 19 gears, 2 rings, 1 rack, 3-Ounce of Spiro-Putty, 3 retractable ball point pens, a 14 page guide book, 20 sheets of design paper and a carry along storage case with a built in work surface.
feature_bullets: Convenient easy to carry case is the work surface and storage unit
Great for creative thinking, shapes and colors and large motor skills
Use with pens with a point size of 1 mm or smaller
